description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to improve the efficiency, effectiveness and safety of the public transport system along the Project Corridor in Metro Manila in an environmentally sustainable manner.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Section I.A&B, Schedule 2 of LA | Description :The Borrower shall maintain the National BRT Steering Committee,NPMO and PIU throughout Project implementation with a mandate, composition and resources satisfactory to the Bank. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Section I.C.1, Schedule 2 of LA | Description :The Borrower shall put in place an overall legal, financial andinstitutional framework acceptable to the Bank for the operation and maintenance of the BRT system in Metro Manila. | Due Date:01-Jan-2020

Finance Agreement :Section I.C.2, Schedule 2 of LA | Description :The Borrower shall enter into one or more contracts withTechnical Support Consultants to support the NPMO and PIU in project management, technical support, procurement, monitoring andevaluation. | Due Date :01-Feb-2018

Finance Agreement :Section I.E, Schedule 2 of LA | Description :The Borrower shall prepare and furnish to the Bank for its approvalannual work and financial plans containing all eligible Project activities and expenditures planned for the following fiscal yearof the Borrower. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section IF1, Schedule 2 of LA | Description :The Borrower, shall ensure that the Project is carried out inaccordance with the provisions of the ESIAs, including the ESMP, the RPF and RAPs in a manner satisfactory to the Bank. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Section IF8, Schedule 2 of LA | Description :The Borrower shall: (a) ensure that any studies to be supportedunder the Project are carried out under terms of reference satisfactory to the Bank and duly incorporate the requirements of Banksafeguard policies and be publicly disclosed and consulted upon in accordance with Bank safeguard policies; and (b) ensure that anycapacity building activities under the Project are consistent with, and pay due attention to, Bank safeguard policies. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Bus routes provided under performance-based contract
BRT bus lane constructed along the project corridor
Government staff and other transport stakeholders participated in BRT and other urban transport training supported by the project
Junctions with improved traffic engineering under the project
Specially designed high quality buses procured
Number of quarterly reports submitted on-time
Pedestrian access facilities improved or upgraded under the project
Annual GHG emissions savings of transport along the project corridor (CO2e emissions per tons per year)
NPMO and PIU staff trained under the project
Public and non-motorized transport user accidents along the project corridor (per vehicle km)
Average travel time for public transport users during AM peak from Manila City Hall to Quezon Memorial Circle Station
Functional BRT Operation Control Center in place
Transport database developed and regularly updated

target.value: Transport database maintained and updated regularly
